meanings.definition: Perception or awareness through the senses.
meanings.sent1: She experienced the beautiful sunset through her sens of sight.
meanings.sent2: His sens of touch told him the water was cold.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sens of smell led it to the hidden treat.
meanings.sent4: Her sens of taste savored the delicious flavors of the meal.
meanings.sent5: The sens of hearing allowed him to enjoy the music concert.

meanings.sent1: Using his sens, he knew not to touch the hot stove.
meanings.sent2: Her sens told her to bring an umbrella when it looked like rain.
meanings.sent3: It took some sens to realize the solution was right in front of them.
meanings.sent4: His sens guided him to make the right decision in a difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: Having sens helped her navigate through the tricky problem easily.

meanings.sent1: The map provided clear sens on how to reach the destination.
meanings.sent2: His speech had a hidden sens that only a few understood.
meanings.sent3: The joke had a playful sens that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The painting's abstract sens left viewers pondering its message.
meanings.sent5: The story had a deep sens that resonated with the audience.
